intro: Ptilotrichum cadevallianum, commonly known as the Cape Verde morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in bright colors such as red, orange, and yellow. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat.
